TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In DATE the applicant was a victim of an accident which occurred at his workplace in the “ Wieczorek ” mine . Subsequently , the applicant received a pension in connection with the work accident .
On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action for compensation and a pension against his former employer .
On DATE ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) partly granted his action and awarded the applicant a pension . The defendant appealed .
On DATE ORG PERSON ) quashed the impugned judgment and remitted the case .
On DATE ORG again partly granted the applicant ’s action and awarded him a pension . The defendant appealed .
On DATE ORG partly quashed the judgment and remitted the remainder of the case to ORG .
On DATE the GPE ORG gave a judgment . The court dismissed the action . The applicant appealed against the judgment .
On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal .
On DATE ORG dismissed his cassation appeal . The applicant was notified about this decision on DATE .
On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action for damages on account of the unreasonable length of the proceedings without specifying the legal grounds of his claim .
On DATE he was invited by ORG to specify the legal basis of his claim .

On DATE the applicant submitted to ORG a statement in which he clarified that his motion should be understood as a complaint about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time under LAW and a request for payment of PLN CARDINAL,CARDINAL . The applicant further added that in the future he might seek compensation in tort from ORG in a separate set of civil proceedings .

On DATE the court rejected the applicant ’s complaint . The court established that LAW had not been applicable as the proceedings complained of had ended before its entry into force . The transitional provision of section CARDINAL of LAW could not be relied on either , as the applicant had lodged his complaint with the ORG after the termination of the domestic proceedings .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-V and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINALVIII and the judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V.
